bill_title: require a temporary permit to be issued to certain persons lacking certain documents when applying for a driver license or nondriver identification card.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require a temporary permit to be issued to certain persons lacking certain documents when applying for a driver license or nondriver identification card. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 32-12 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If an applicant making application for an operator's license, motorcycle operator's license, restricted minor's permit, motorcycle restricted minor's permit, instruction permit, motorcycle instruction permit, or nondriver identification card does not have the documents required by § 32-12-3.1, 32-12-3.3, 32-12-3.4, or 32-12-3.5, the applicant lives more than fifty miles from a driver exam station, and the applicant would otherwise qualify for the license or permit, the Department of Public Safety shall issue a temporary permit pursuant to § 32-12-19. The temporary permit shall be valid for one year or until the documents are provided and the applicant's license or permit is issued, whichever period is shorter. 170 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.093 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
